title: Tilla Weinstein
summary: Tilla Weinstein (1934–2002, née Savanuck, also published as Tilla Klotz and Tilla K. Milnor) was an American mathematician  known for her mentorship of younger women in mathematics. Her research concerned differential geometry, including conformal structures, harmonic maps, and Lorentz surfaces. She taught for many years at Rutgers University, where she headed the mathematics department in the Douglass Residential College.[1]
